official-title.#text: To ensure that members of the Armed Forces and Federal law enforcement officers continue to receive their pay and allowances despite a shutdown of the Federal Government or in the event that the debt of the United States Government reaches the statutory limit.

header.#text: Payment of pay and allowances for members of the Armed Forces and Federal law enforcement officers during Federal Government shutdown or despite reaching statutory debt limit

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall transfer to the head of the appropriate Executive agency such amounts as are necessary to continue such activities:

text.#text: During any funding gap during fiscal year 2014 when interim or full-year appropriations for the following activities have not been enacted, from amounts in the general fund of the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, the

header.#text: Continuation during a federal government shutdown

text.#text: The payment of pay and allowances for members of the Armed Forces (including reserve components thereof) on active duty.
The payment of salaries and benefits for sworn Federal law enforcement officers.

text.#text: In the event that the debt of the United States Government reaches the statutory limit as defined in

header.#text: Continuation despite reaching statutory debt limit

text.#text: The payment of pay and allowances for members of the Armed Forces (including reserve components thereof) on active duty.
The payment of salaries and benefits for sworn Federal law enforcement officers.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 3216 IH: To ensure that members of the Armed Forces and Federal law enforcement officers continue to receive their pay and allowances despite a shutdown of the Federal Government or in the event that the debt of the United States Government reaches the statutory limit.
